definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: Sadly enough, the generator was all but forgotten during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 但不幸的是，這些機器在二戰期間被完全遺忘廢置。

sentences.english: Devices fall out of favor, but seldom if ever get abolished by design.
sentences.chinese: 設備被完全廢置很少見，即使在設計上完全廢棄。

sentences.english: It must have seemed the logical place to abandon the trains which were no longer needed.
sentences.chinese: 它似乎成了丟棄廢置火車的理想之地。

sentences.english: API-cleaning by removing deprecated artefacts and minor changes.
sentences.chinese: 通過移除廢置的工件和細微的變化整理了API。

sentences.english: These changes might be revised or reverted before going live.
sentences.chinese: 這些改動在上線之前都有可能被修改或是廢置。

sentences.english: A fatal explosion at a plastics factory being dismantled in Nanjing is the latest in a series.
sentences.chinese: 日前，一間位於南京的廢置塑膠廠發生爆炸。
